title: Projects
text: While running a Minecraft club at school, amidst our activities, the offline middle school graduation ceremony was suddenly canceled due to the COVID-19 in late 2020. Putting aside our disappointment, I initiated a project with my club friends to recreate our school in Minecraft during the online class period. Using photos of the school’s exteriors, hallways, and classroom interiors taken by some of my friends who visited the school, we worked tirelessly for several nights to construct the school. Drawing from my experience as an editor on the Korean Minecraft Forum, I used the Littletiles mod, which allowed me to carve blocks at a pixel level and create custom doors, to depict the school in a more realistic manner. Additionally, using the Aperture mod that supports awesome advanced camera movement, I was able to produce dynamic showcase video. As a result, on the day of the online graduation ceremony, my friends and I gathered at the virtual school we had built in Minecraft and held a remote graduation ceremony. You can check the video of remote ceremony at my friend’s youtube.

title: Projects
text:
Pygame Project (November 2021)

I also enjoy developing my own games. I developed a game for the first time called Black and White for my first-grade CS class performance assessment. The experience of creating everything from pixel art to music with my team members was really enjoyable. The concept of the game was that the background color inverts when the space bar is pressed, and the visible obstacles change. You can view the Launch trailer that I made.

title: Projects
text:
2022 Korea Youth Game Jam (August 2022)


I participated in the 2022 Korea Youth Game Jam (I’m the one in the second picture!) and won the Grand prize with my teammates. You can watch the gameplay video here.

section: Woongjin Math Game Development Challenge (August 2022 ~ December 2022)
text:
Woongjin Math Game Development Challenge (August 2022 ~ December 2022)

Additionally, based on this game development experience, I participated in the Woongjin Math Game Development Challenge and received an $1,000 with my team for the participant award.

title: Projects
section: Viva la vida loopstation performance at charity concert (November 2022)
text:
Viva la vida loopstation performance at charity concert (November 2022)

Aside from math and science, I like to compose and play my own music. You can also check out my Soundcloud. I performed “Viva La Vida” by Coldplay with a loop station at the Music Sharing Concert with Seoul International High School. You can watch my performance video here.

title: Projects
text:
World Mathematics Team Championship (November 2023)

I gathered a team at school and competed in WMTC 2023 as ‘Team Burvaki’. Our team ranked 2nd overall, and I achieved 9th place individually with gold medal. 2023 WMTC results

title: Projects
text:
Everyone’s OCW
To realize the freedom of learning!

title: print(“Hello, World!”)
text: Starting a blog is always a lot of fun.

title: print(“Hello, World!”)
text:
About me
Hi, as I said at the main page, I am student at Seoul Science High School, studying math, computer science and physics. I’m interested at homotopy type theory, formal verification and cosmology, and so on. Currently, I’m studying type theory, and proof assistant, such as Lean and Coq.

title: print(“Hello, World!”)
section: Purpose of blogging and what will I post
text:
Purpose of blogging and what will I post
Sharing my thoughts and summarizing the materials I’ve studied through blog posts provides me with motivation and encourages me to approach life with greater enthusiasm. The upcoming blog posts will cover the following topics:

Personal Project Promotion
I am currently working on various projects in various fields such as “모두의 OCW” (Everyone’s OCW), study on ATP(Automated Theorem Proving), and pygame projects etc. I plan to promote and provide brief introductions to these projects. There are many exciting projects, so be sure to check them out when they are published.
Recent Research Trends Review
In any field I am studying (formal verification, mathematics, game programming, physics - especially cosmology), if there are noteworthy recent studies worth sharing, I will read and summarize research papers and results to present in informative posts.
My Educational Values
Education is a strong passion of mine, and I aspire to provide quality education to young students in the future. The “Everyone’s OCW” project also aligns with this goal. Establishing educational values and writing about them will likely be personally rewarding and beneficial.
Various Well-Organized Posts
Quality content improves with each post! Even if the content doesn’t specifically pertain to math or science, if I believe my arguments or various news items are worth sharing with others, I will organize them effectively and share them here.

With that said, I am excited for the journey ahead!

title: Welcome to my website!
text:
Hi, I am student at Seoul Science High School, studying math, computer science and physics. I’m interested at homotopy type theory, formal verification and cosmology, and so on. Currently, I’m studying type theory, and proof assistant, such as Lean and Coq.
Aside from math and science, I like to compose and play my own music. You can also check out my Soundcloud. I performed “Viva La Vida” by Coldplay with a loop station at the Music Sharing Concert with Seoul International High School. You can watch my performance video here.
I also enjoy developing my own games. I developed a game for the first time called Black and White for my first-grade CS class performance assessment. The experience of creating everything from pixel art to music with my team members was really enjoyable. The concept of the game was that the background color inverts when the space bar is pressed, and the visible obstacles change. You can view the Launch trailer that I made.
Moreover, I participated in the 2022 Korea Youth Game Jam (I’m the one in the second picture!) and won the Grand prize with my teammates. You can watch the gameplay video here. Additionally, based on this game development experience, I participated in the Woongjin Math Game Development Challenge and received an $1,000 with my team for the participant award.
Thank you for visiting my website. I hope you have some fun!
